Bash(.venv/Scripts/python.exe -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert(0, ''./src'')
from laser_trim_analyzer.gui.widgets.chart_widget import ChartWidget
from laser_trim_analyzer.gui.widgets.charts import ChartWidget as CW2
print(''ChartWidget imported successfully'')
print(f''ChartWidget class: {ChartWidget}'')
print(f''Both imports match: {ChartWidget is CW2}'')
print(f''Methods available: plot_line={hasattr(ChartWidget, ""plot_line"")}, plot_gauge={hasattr(ChartWidget, ""plot_gauge"")}, plot_early_warning_system={hasattr(ChartWidget, ""plot_early_warning_system"")}'')
")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
[V3] Major fixes: parsing, dates, batch summary, charts

Fixes:
- Model parsing: preserve suffixes (8340-1 not truncated to 8340)
- Serial parsing: extract correct serial (not year from date)
- Date extraction: parse trim date from filename (M-D-YYYY pattern)
- Batch summary: properly count WARNING status separately
- Charts: dynamic resizing, spec limits from file, untrimmed data
- Database: store/retrieve spec limits and untrimmed data
- Excel export: single Trim Date column, correct status counts
- Window: reduced minimum size to 800x600 for laptops

Files changed:
- parser.py: filename parsing for model/serial/date
- processor.py: batch summary counting
- models.py: added warnings field to BatchSummary
- manager.py: update logic finds by filename, stores untrimmed data
- excel.py: simplified dates, proper status breakdown
- chart.py: debounced resize handling
- analyze.py: database browser with spec limits on charts
- process.py: display warnings in summary
- app.py: reduced minsize

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
